prompt.content: TASK: Two sets of playing cards will be provided. These sets of cards are the hole and community cards in a no limit texas holdem poker game, respectively. Based on the cards available, return the highest rank of hand that can be formed with these cards. Return only the rank of the hand and no additional information.

data.sampled:
A: One pair.
The highest hand that can be formed with the given cards is a pair of Queens. Please note that this is a basic poker hand rankings system and it doesn't take into account the probability of winning with the given hand nor it takes into account the game dynamics like blinds, position for betting, etc...
A pair of queens (QsQd) is better then a pair of Kings (KsKh), pair of tens (TsTh) or a pair of five (5s5d), but note that hand value could change based on the cards that didn't appear (Cards that didn't be exposed)  and the probability of the opponent's cards.
In a poker game, other factors like players' strategy, betting patterns, and the strength of opponents' cards can affect the outcome of the game, so it's not possible to accurately determine a hand rank without additional information. This is just a basic guide to the relative strength of the hand.

data.sampled:
A: Three of a kind (three Kings)
Note: The highest rank of hand that can be formed with the given cards. The value of the cards and suits are used to determine the hand rank. The 9s in the community cards does not affect the hand rank in this scenario. In this case, the three Kings in the hole cards, combined with the one King in the community cards, forms the highest rank of hand, which is Three of a kind (or aFull House) with Kings.
